settings.title: Anti-Dandruff Shampoo
settings.subtitle: Dandruff is a scalp condition where the dead skin cells flake off, often onto the shoulders and clothing. It can often be accompanied by itchy and dry skin in the affected areas. See below or anti-dandruff shampoo products.

settings.title: What does dandruff look like?
settings.text: There are a few symptoms of dandruff that can appear. These symptoms usually involve scaly or itchy skin, a red rash or flaky/crusty patches of skin.

settings.title: What causes dandruff?
settings.text: Dandruff can be caused by several different types of scalp conditions. These conditions are categorised by the underlying causes such as dry skin, oily skin, fungus related, disease-related, seborrheic (severe oiliness), and eczema or psoriasis

settings.title: What can I use to treat dandruff?
settings.text: You can treat dandruff by using an anti-dandruff shampoo. You should trial the shampoos for a month to see if they work effectively at fixing your dandruff concerns.

settings.title: Can I treat my dandruff at home?
settings.text: You can treat your dandruff at home using anti-dandruff shampoos.

settings.title: Is dandruff a fungus?
settings.text: A very common fungus called malassezia is thought to be the main contributor to dandruff.

settings.title: Is it dandruff or dry scalp?
settings.text: Larger and oily flakes are typically dandruff while smaller, dry flakes are usually an indication of a dry scalp.
